author: VNExplorer
title: Influencer Reeflay Papini mata a su novia por un reto viral
text: Youtuber ruso mata a su novia por un reto en internet El video del youtuber ruso Stanislav Reshétnikov, conocido como Reeflay Panini, volvió a viralizarse en 2024, reabriendo un debate sobre los peligros del contenido extremo en las redes sociales. En 2020, Reshétnikov encerró a su novia, Valentina Grigórieva, en un balcón bajo temperaturas extremas en Moscú durante una transmisión en vivo, provocando su muerte por hipotermia. A pesar de su condena a seis años de prisión, el caso sigue resonando en la sociedad. Reeflay Panini, que entonces contaba con un número significativo de seguidores en sus redes sociales, se dedicaba a realizar lo que hoy conocemos como "trash streaming", un formato en el que los espectadores ofrecen donaciones a cambio de que el influencer realice retos crueles y denigrantes. TE PUEDE INTERESAR: Difunden video de increíble rescate con dron de un joven que estaba en una torre El fatídico reto del youtuber Stas Reeflay En diciembre de 2020, este peligroso juego tuvo un desenlace fatal cuando, por una apuesta de mil dólares, Reshétnikov encerró a su novia, Valentina Grigórieva, en el balcón de su departamento en Moscú, bajo temperaturas extremadamente bajas. La joven de 26 años, que estaba aparentemente embarazada, murió de hipotermia tras haber permanecido en el balcón durante horas, mientras su pareja continuaba transmitiendo en vivo. El caso de Reeflay Panini generó una ola de indignación en su momento, y la justicia rusa no tardó en actuar. En 2021, Reshétnikov fue condenado a seis años de prisión por homicidio involuntario. Sin embargo, a pesar de la sentencia, el dolor y la conmoción que provocó el suceso parecían haber quedado en el pasado, hasta que un video que documenta parte del incidente resurgió en las redes en 2024. La viralización del video ha reabierto viejas heridas y ha vuelto a poner en la mesa la discusión sobre los límites del contenido en las plataformas digitales. En las imágenes, se puede ver a Reshétnikov ignorando las súplicas de Grigórieva durante la transmisión, en la que pedía ayuda desesperadamente mientras luchaba por sobrevivir en el frío implacable. La tragedia de Valentina Grigórieva no es un hecho aislado. Casos como el de Valentin Ganichev, el de Mellstroy, un youtuber que fue expulsado de su plataforma tras golpear a una mujer durante una transmisión en vivo, ilustran los peligros de este tipo de contenido. Estos incidentes continúan siendo un recordatorio alarmante de las consecuencias que puede tener la búsqueda desenfrenada de fama en las redes sociales. TE PUEDE INTERESAR: Mexicana en Japón muestra cómo se preparan tras la alerta de un megaterremoto de magnitud 9 Con el video de Reeflay Panini nuevamente en el centro de atención, la discusión sobre la regulación del contenido en línea y la cultura de la audiencia se ha intensificado, mientras muchos piden acciones más estrictas para prevenir que situaciones tan lamentables vuelvan a ocurrir. Para más noticias, no olvides seguirnos en nuestras redes sociales, unirte a nuestro canal de WhatsApp canal de WhatsApp y suscribirte a nuestro Newsletter.

author: Orpheus Joshua
title: Harvest Moon: The Lost Valley & Skytree Village Delayed to July 3 on Switch
text:
Natsume has announced that Harvest Moon: The Lost Valley & Skytree Village has been delayed from June 2025 to July 3, 2025, for Nintendo Switch.
CEO Hiro Maekawa said the following:
We look forward to bringing Harvest Moon: The Lost Valley and Harvest Moon: Skytree Village to Nintendo Switch on July 3 as we release our first Cozy Bundle.
The team has been working hard on optimizing these 3DS titles for Switch, ensuring high quality and updated features. We hope this will be the first of many bundles featuring classic Natsume games that fans have been wanting to play on modern consoles.
This collection includes Harvest Moon: The Lost Valley and Harvest Moon: Skytree Village , which are now together on one game card. Both games feature terrain customization, farming, relationships, and exploration.
Harvest Moon: The Lost Valley Initially released in 2014 for the Nintendo 3DS, The Lost Valley follows a journey to restore the missing seasons of a magical valley.
After taking shelter from a snowstorm, you awaken to a world where winter never ends, and with the help of Harvest Sprites, the Harvest Goddess, and the King of the Underworld, you set out to bring balance back to nature.
Features:
Farm and raise animals – Grow crops and care for cows, chickens, and sheep. Customize the terrain – Dig, build, and reshape the land. Harness the power of Harvest Sprites Find love and start a family – Build relationships, get married, and raise a child. All DLC included – Extra outfits, buildings, crops, and additional characters. Harvest Moon: Skytree Village Released in 2016 for the Nintendo 3DS, Skytree Village takes players to a once-thriving land now suffering from drought and decay. The Harvest Goddess has lost her power, and only by reviving the seven Skytrees can the land be restored.
Features:
Meet and befriend villagers Fully customize the land Romance & marriage – Choose from multiple bachelors and bachelorettes. Expanded farming & fishing – Grow new crops and flowers, improve waterways, and catch rare fish. All DLC included – Unlock additional characters and cosmetic items. Release & Collector’s Edition Harvest Moon: The Lost Valley & Skytree Village will be available both digitally and physically worldwide, with regional publishers as follows:
North America & Japan – Natsume Inc. Europe – Numskull Games Asia – Soft Source Numskull Games’ Collector’s Edition (Europe) will include:
The game (Switch physical copy) 2 Sticker Sheets 2 Diorama Backgrounds (to place stickers on) Original Soundtrack CD A4 Double-Sided Poster
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Michael Cuneo
title: Rolesville basketball handles Hoggard, advances to state championship
text: WINSTON-SALEM—The Hoggard girls basketball team's overwhelmingly successful season ended in the NCHSAA 4A East Regional Championship at Lawrence Joel Veterans Memorial Coliseum on Thursday. The top-seeded Vikings (30-2) did their best to rally from a seven-point halftime deficit but ultimately fell short to No. 2-seeded Rolesville 47-34. "I want to make sure that my players understand what they've accomplished and how proud I am of what they've done," Hoggard coach Boubacar Aw said. REGIONAL BRACKETS 2024 NCHSAA basketball regional championships live updates for Hoggard, New Hanover OUR PREDICTIONS How can New Hanover, Hoggard basketball make a state championship this week? Sophomore Avery Fitzgerald led all Viking scorers with 10 points. Fellow sophomore Tristan Rivers had seven, and senior Sarah Elgart had six. "I really think (this season's success) was all about teamwork," Elgart said. "Chemistry is a very big part of being a successful team, and I think we really accomplished that." Rolesville's Caitlyn Jones led all scorers with 11 points. Teammate Taliya Rowe scored 10. "We kind of fell out of that No. 1 spot when we lost to Wakefield in the conference tournament, but we showed everybody today we are the No. 1 team out of the 4A East," Rolesville coach Nikita Warren said. Despite being the East's No. 1 seed, Hoggard's young makeup and inexperience made the team an underdog all postseason, something Aw says made his team's run all the more impressive. "I've got to be very honest, after losing seven seniors, I never thought that we would have gotten this far because I knew we had a very young group. For them to just say we'll do anything you want us to do, as a coach, I am extremely proud." For Shivers, who led the Vikings in scoring all season long as only a sophomore, the loss didn't diminish her teams strides this winter. "I think it really just hit me in 40 seconds how much work we put in over this season," Shivers said. "I think with the leadership of all our seniors, they all contributed way more than anybody could imagine." The Vikings finish the season 30-2, reaching the program's first regional final since 2015. "I told (my players) in the locker room there is no reason to cry," Aw said. "They reached the sky, so what are we going to cry about? We are proud of them and I'm pretty sure the whole community is pretty proud of these young ladies and they should be."
